thank you so much for joining us on this
incredibly busy day for you I just
wonder if you can categorize the mood in
Damascus at the moment well it might
surprise you Matthew the mood is
surprisingly calm we were just heading
over to one of the area's driving past
that research facility that was a bombed
early in the morning and we spoke with a
number of people actually lined up
getting bread and groceries in the
morning and they said they were jolted
awake around four o'clock in the morning
they heard a number of very loud thuds
but they said they couldn't fall back
asleep but they said that in many ways
they have gotten used to these types of
sounds the sound of air strikes over the
last seven plus years as this war has
ground into its eighth year it was
interesting we've been on the ground
here in Damascus for a couple of days
and in the lead up there was a almost a
nonchalance almost a disbelief that
these strikes would indeed take place
many people questioned the basis for
them altogether but of many of us here
in the capital city and Damascus were
jolted awake around four o'clock in the
morning we were standing on this balcony
and hearing these loud thuds these loud
booms almost sounded like thunder but
instead of being in the sky was almost
like thunder emanating from the horizon
Matthew
yeah and so if you mentioned that you
went to see one of the facilities that
was hit what did you see can you
categorize the kind of damage are you in
any position to give us any analysis
about the the degradation of that
facility we were driving around that

those buildings that building it appears
to be completely destroyed in the

unbelievably the neighbors relatively
based people described going to their

kind of display in the sky as we watched
it was interesting to be listening to
President Trump speak in one ear and
looking out over this city
watching anti-aircraft fire and also
seeing or hearing those airstrikes hit
their targets around Damascus
[Applause]

wonder finally as you know the White

absolutely the spin machines are working

not being deterred by these strikes
we've also heard spin from their

in Assad's government said if there's
only one Syrian left that's German will

today
